intro: Caesalpinia cavanillesii, commonly known as the flame bean or golden wisteria, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its compound leaves and striking orange to red floral clusters that resemble wisteria. The plant produces elongated, flat pods that contain several seeds, and it thrives in full sun with well-drained soil. Caesalpinia cavanillesii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and visually appealing plant in tropical gardens.
